DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to prospectively investigate the diagnostic performance and potential radiation dose reduction in coronary artery calcium scoring using the new tin filter system of the 3rd generation DSCT scanner.
DOC.criteria: Subject must be between 1990 years of age. Subject must have been referred for a clinically indicated coronary artery calcium scan and/or coronary CT angiography or TRO scan with coronary artery calcium scoring. Subject must provide written informed consent prior to any studyrelated procedures being performed. Subject must be willing to comply with all clinical study procedures. Subject is a pregnant or nursing female. Exclude the possibility of pregnancy: By testing (urine BHCG) within 24 hours before scan, or By surgical sterilization, or Post menopausal, with minimum one (1) year history without menses. Subject has an acute psychiatric disorder or is cognitively impaired. Subject is using or is dependent on substances of abuse. Subject is unwilling to comply with the requirements of the protocol. Subject is in acute unstable condition.
